description.narrative: House of Europe is an EU-funded programme fostering professional and creative exchange between Ukrainians and their colleagues in EU countries. The programme focuses on different professional fields: culture and creative industries, education, health, social entrepreneurship, media, and youth. The programme House of Europe is managed by the Consortium of Goethe-Institut (GI), British Council, České Centrum (ČC) Institut Français d’Ukraine (IFU) in partnership with the European Union National Institutes of Culture (EUNIC) Cluster in Ukraine. Programme duration is from April 2019 to March 2023. For more details: www.houseofeurope.org.ua As a Consortium Partner the British Council is delivering five work packages (projects) within the House of Europe. They are: University Exchanges – credit-bearing mobility for students of Higher Education institutions in different parts of Ukraine aimed to foster interregional academic cooperation between universities and to enhance people-to-people exchange and cultural dialogue between young Ukrainians. Active Citizens – is a youth-oriented platform for development of leadership skills and social responsibility through experience exchange, ideas generation and bringing awareness of possibilities for their community development. Creative Enterprise Ukraine – business skills capacity building programme for emerging creative entrepreneurs across all sectors of the creative industries. Based on the methodology of the UK’s innovations agency Nesta. Study Tours for Creative Hubs Managers – a series of study tours for managers of Ukrainian-based creative hubs to the EU countries in order to observe European experience and models in running and managing creative hubs. Study Tours for Social Entrepreneurs – a series of study tours for Ukrainian social entrepreneurs to the EU countries in order to observe European experience and models in social enterprise.

Overall objectives of the House of Europe programme: Contribution to the advancement of Ukrainian reforms in culture and Cultural and Creative Industries (CCI), education, health, media, social enterprise (SE), and youth. Contribution to a stronger mutual understanding and dialogue between the EU and the Ukrainian society and within Ukraine. Supporting tolerance and cultural diversity in Ukraine and a stronger internal cohesion within Ukraine. To broaden people-to-people contacts and hands-on exposure to EU working cultures in key reform areas, enabling Ukrainian professionals to gain a better understanding of EU acquis and realities and benefits of a partnership with the EU. To enhance sustainable interregional and international cultural, intellectual, artistic and youth exchanges, fostering mobility and mutual understanding among the target groups. Participants and alumni become change agents within their communities and work context. To raise awareness of EU and EU Member States’ programmes for Ukraine, increasing synergies between different EU Member States’ programmes and activities throughout the country and thus enhancing cooperation and contacts between the target groups of the Ukrainian society and the EU.

The programme includes several activities in 5 programmes delivered by British Council: Creative Enterprise Ukraine training - workshops for up to 25 creative entrepreneurs, Forum for creative entrepreneurs. Study Tours for Creative Hubs - a five days’ tour to an EU country or the UK offering some specific focus on managing and running creative hubs. Each tour accommodates eight participants and one British Council team representative. Study Tours for Social Entrepreneurs : A five days’ tour to an EU country or the UK offering some specific focus on managing and running a social entreprise. Each tour accommodates eight participants and one British Council team representative. Active Citizens (AC) camp: Offline camp – a 5-day event that includes Active Citizens training, meetings with the community leaders, authorities and entrepreneurs, networking etc. Online camp – a 2,5-week event that includes AC training, meetings with Ukrainian and European community leaders University Exchanges - Academic mobility programme to exchange students within pairs of universities from different regions of Ukraine. Each exchange is a short one that lasts from 4 to 12 weeks, and is based on a credit transfer scheme (ECTS).

The programme’s target groups are higher education institutions and students, community leaders and influencers, local civil society organisations (CSOs), cultural and socials entrepreneurs, creative hubs managers, medical staff (doctors and nurses), hospital top/middle management, NGO staff in the health sector, medical researchers, physiotherapists, paramedics, professional journalists and journalism students, citizen journalists, teachers and managers of journalism schools and media organisations, young people (secondary school age +), youth leaders and activists.

name.narrative: This is a national programme, delivered across Ukraine.
